name: Downings Bay Hotel

reviews.text: The rooms and decor are generally of good quality and tidy, however on returning to our room the first evening to shower and change we found there was no water to shower, brush teeth or flush the toilet. I phoned reception who non-chalantly offered to take me to another room on the first floor for a shower - no apology or explanation offered! (I later found out from another guest this had been going on all day, with other guest being ferried to the first floor all day).
reviews.title: Waterless 2nd floor (i kid you not!!) and noisy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Another piece of advice reception fail to mention, the disco in the adjoining building went on until 02.45 in the morning so forget trying to get to sleep any sooner than that.
reviews.title: their 3*star Hotel rating is at a squeeze.

reviews.text: Be aware of these things as staff will not tell you in advance!! This was undoubtedly a rip off for a so called three star hotel, i would rather sleep on the beach than stay here again.
reviews.title: Nice hotel but service needs improving

reviews.text: Reception staff were welcoming and pleasant. We were given a choice of rooms even though both had there inadequacies. One room being right over the disco, the other had the kitchen extractorfan flue noise up to 10.30pm .
reviews.title: Pleasant stay, but need to work on their room descriptions and attitude

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We opted for the flue room 116 ,considering we were late night sleepers.Over our two nite stay they kitchen flue was at an acceptable noise level and was prompt to be switched off.
reviews.title: Great Time

reviews.text: This hotel was just fantastic, i really enjoyed my 2 nights there. The rooms were spotless and very comfortable. The residents bar was very friendle and in no hurry to close. The staff were very helpfull and the food was absolutly fantastic. I will deffinetly be back.
reviews.title: beautiful hotel

likes.liked: — the location was great and the hotel was beautiful

reviews.text: Be cautious, very cautious if you are considering reserving this hotel, in particular over a festive period. I had originally reserved 2 rooms at Downings Bay but our arrangements changed and when I contacted the hotel to cancel 1 room, I was told I would lose the 100 euro deposit I had paid! I gave them 6 weeks prior notice of this cancellation but they refused to reimburse the 100 euro! I was very tempted to cancel our planned stay here because of this but if I had cancelled I would have lost another 100 euro!
reviews.title: Reserve with Caution!

likes.disliked: — Manner in which complaints are dealt with

reviews.text: The hotel is clean and comfortable. We stayed in room 105, upon drawing back the curtains we had NO view, only a corrugated roof approximately 6 inches from the window. There would be a similar view from rooms 107 and 109. If you are going here for peace and relaxation forget it, disco music invades the bedroom until 2.30 in the morning.
reviews.title: Great Location on the Donegal Coast

reviews.text: The food is good and staff are pleasant however when you leave the corridor from the bedrooms to descend stairs to the reception you are permanently met with the smell of cigarette smoke. Turns out there is a set of wooden double doors at the bottom of stairs and this is where the staff smoke.
reviews.title: OK but shame about the 'niteclub'

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We made the best of our costly stay here, but would I recommend it putting aside the fact that they would not refund deposit, NO?
reviews.title: not quite what i expected

likes.liked: — The room was new and modern

reviews.text: We spent one night in this pleasant and very convenient hotel when we attended a large family wedding in Rosapenna. We were greeted warmly and very quickly we were in our spacious and immaculately clean bedroom.We were running a bit late for the wedding church ceremony so we were very glad of the efficient desk service.
reviews.title: Friendly service in a clean and pleasant seaside hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Comfortable beds, large bathroom with bath and some good quality towels and lovely shower gels made our overnight stay a restful experience.The hotel was quiet inside and well sound proofed which was very welcome as there was quite a lot of late night activity outside !
reviews.title: 3 Star hotel with 5 Star staff and service

reviews.text: Breakfast was good and again the service was very efficient.We would have liked some good Donegal wholemeal bread to accompany our full Irish breakfast but that's a minor quibble.We wish we could have availed of the special 2 night deal on offer but maybe next time!
reviews.title: Suprise, what a great place to stay

reviews.text: My wife and I stayed in Downings Bay Hotel for the weekend. I had read the reviews in Trip adviser and some were not very complimentary.
reviews.title: GREAT HOTEL IN A WONDERFUL SETTING

reviews.text: My wife and I had a fabulous time. The hotel was very comfortable. The room was bright and big. The food in the Haven Restaurant was excellent. The staff were cheerful,friendly and courteous. The staff made a good experience a brilliant experience. I would gladly recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: Could have been better & so easy to fix...

reviews.text: My wife and I enjoyed a two night stay at the Downings Bay Hotel and found the hotel to be a modern, well furnished and very comfortable.
reviews.title: A Modern well Furnished Hotel
Downings Bay - excellent base
reviews.text: All the staff from the manager Eileen Rock down were extremely helpfull and polite and made our stay a most enjoyable one. The food in the restaraunt was to a very high standard it being obvious that the chef took a great deal of care and pride in the preparation and presentation of the meals and the large bar area also served food most of the day which looked to be very good value for money.

description: In the North West of Donegal on the beautiful Sheephaven Bay lies the thoroughly modern and luxurious Downings Bay Hotel with our award winning accommodation. The Sheephaven Suite is available for 20 – 350 people. JC’s Bar & the Haven Dining Room serve locally sourced fresh food daily. Magherabeg Leisure Centre & Kidz Kingdom are available complimentary to hotel guests. Local activities include golf, fishing, walking, horse riding & water sports. Within driving distance of Glenveagh National Park & Horn Head.
